Description: Stone stela with Greek inscription: tombstone of Teaos. Cut down and re-used perhaps as a pilaster capital as its second function. Off-centre cup-like depression on rear, probably used for door pivot and threshold as its third function. Shelly limestone.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of the Dioskouroi (Naukratis), In or near; probably not original location
Curator's comments: Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 195. Such shelly limestone was used to create the warrior and old man reliefs of the Hellenion. Common limestone used in Alexandria. Unlikely to be from Nile Valley as better limestone sources known in Memphis area. Name, Teaos.

This was probably not the original location but secondary use. Gardner states this was found 'in or near the temenos of the Dioskouroi', and so at the southern limit of the cemetery (Gardner 1888, 22).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXX, no. 1)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (no. 32, pl. 41, 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CC.02)
